{
  "article_text": [
    "in the study of dynamical systems _ time _ is usually modeled as discrete or continuous .",
    "a discrete - time dynamical system can be understood as an action of the integers , induced by a homeomorphism or a diffeomorphism .",
    "the continuous time can be represented by the real numbers , and the dynamics is generated by a vector field or a flow .",
    "both categories are strongly related and several definitions and results can be _",
    "translated_. for example , expansivity is defined in both categories .",
    "recall that a homeomorphism @xmath0 of a compact metric space @xmath1 is an _ expansive homeomorphism _ if there is @xmath2 such that @xmath3 for all @xmath4 implies @xmath5 . for flows ,",
    "the definition of @xcite is a good translation in terms of the results that it allows to recover .",
    "it saids that a flow @xmath6 is an _ expansive flow _ if for all @xmath7 there is @xmath8 such that if @xmath9 for all @xmath10 with @xmath11 an increasing homeomorphism such that @xmath12 then there is @xmath13 such that @xmath14 .",
    "the complexity of the definition makes the translations very difficult , but several techniques were developed .",
    "see for example @xcite .",
    "the purpose of the present article is to develop the technique of local cross sections for translating some definitions and results from discrete to continuous topological dynamical systems on compact metric spaces . in order to describe our results",
    "let us consider a non - singular smooth flow @xmath15 , @xmath16 , on a compact manifold @xmath17 with a transverse foliation . given a point @xmath18",
    "we can take a compact disc @xmath19 of radius @xmath2 contained in the leaf of @xmath20 .",
    "if @xmath21 is small we have that :    1 .   for each @xmath2 and @xmath18",
    ", @xmath19 is a local cross section containing @xmath20 , 2 .",
    "the map @xmath22 is continuous , embeddings . in the context of metric spaces we will consider the hausdorff metric between compact subsets of @xmath23 . ] 3 .",
    "( monotonous ) for @xmath24 small @xmath19 is disjoint from @xmath25 , 4 .",
    "( symmetric ) if @xmath26 are close then @xmath27 if and only if @xmath28 .",
    "such a map @xmath29 , depending on @xmath21 and @xmath20 , is an example of what we call _ field of cross sections _ and it is illustrated in figure [ figsecs ] .",
    "[ figsecs ]    then , if the flow is defined on a manifold and it admits a transverse foliation the construction is trivial .",
    "but it is known that there are smooth flows without a transverse foliation , see for example @xcite . for these cases",
    "we have an alternative construction .",
    "suppose that @xmath30 is the velocity field of the flow . on a compact smooth manifold",
    "we can consider a riemannian metric and define @xmath31 where @xmath32 is the exponential map of the riemannian metric and @xmath2 is small .",
    "this definition can be found for example in @xcite .",
    "unfortunately , in this setting items 3 and 4 above may not hold . for continuous ( non - smooth )",
    "flows on compact manifolds the task is even harder .",
    "a related construction is given in @xcite for studying expansive flows of three - manifolds .",
    "on metric spaces local cross sections were constructed in @xcite . in @xcite",
    "local cross sections are used in the study of non - smooth expansive flows on manifolds and metric spaces .",
    "in @xcite they consider a finite cover of flow boxes and the corresponding return maps .",
    "this approach is a good translating tool but it has some technical difficulties that makes it hard to handle .",
    "for example , the return maps may not be continuous at the boundary of the cross sections .",
    "in this article we consider regular flows ( no singular points ) on compact metric spaces . in section [ secfocs ]",
    "we develop a theory of fields of local cross sections . in theorem [ main1 ]",
    "we prove that every regular flow on a compact metric space admits a semicontinuous , monotonous and symmetric field of cross sections .",
    "if in addition we have that the space is a peano continuum , in theorem [ seccontmonsym ] we conclude that the cross sections can be assumed to vary continuously , each one being a connected set .",
    "precise definitions are given in section [ secfocs ] .",
    "as a translating tool , one may think of the cross section @xmath19 as the ball @xmath33 in the discrete time case . to show how this works",
    "let us translate the definition of wandering point . recall that if @xmath0 is a homeomorphism of a metric space then @xmath34 is a _ wandering point _",
    "if :    _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ \\(1 ) there is @xmath2 such that @xmath35 for all @xmath36 .",
    "_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _    if @xmath37 is a flow on @xmath23 a point @xmath34 is said to be a _ wandering point _ if :    _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ \\(2 ) there are @xmath38 such that @xmath39 for all @xmath40 .",
    "_ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _    in this definition there is a parameter @xmath41 that is not present in ( 1 ) . using a local cross section",
    "we have that @xmath20 is a wandering point of the flow @xmath37 if and only if :    _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ \\(3 ) there is @xmath2 such that @xmath42 for all @xmath43 . _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _    notice that ( 3 ) is obtained from ( 1 ) by changing @xmath44 and @xmath45 .",
    "this is a task that a _ translating machine _ can do .",
    "this machine needs to be programmed and the present paper is intended to be a contribution in this direction .    in section [ seccwexp ] we show how this machine should work in a more complex situation .",
    "we consider expansive flows on peano continua and we translate some results of expansive homeomorphisms . as said in the abstract , we prove that expansive flows do not admit stable points .",
    "we show that every point contains a non - trivial continuum in its stable set and as a corollary we prove that no compact surface admits an expansive flow without singular points .",
    "in this section we introduce the fields of compact sets , which assigns to each point a compact subset through the point .",
    "this concept is related with the _ coselections _ defined in @xcite .",
    "fields of cross sections of a flow are a special instance of such fields .    in section [ secccs ]",
    "we show that every regular flow admits a field of cross sections . for this purpose",
    "we extend the techniques of @xcite while introducing topological 1-forms . in section [ seccfcs ]",
    "we consider flows on peano continua . in this case",
    "we show that every regular flow admits a continuous field of connected cross sections . in section [ sectff ]",
    "we introduce the transposition of fields of compact sets and 1-forms .",
    "these techniques are used in section [ secmfcs ] to construct monotonous fields of cross sections . in section [ secsfcs ]",
    "we show that every regular flow admits a symmetric field of cross sections .",
    "the main results of this section are theorems [ main1 ] and [ seccontmonsym ] .",
    "let @xmath1 be a compact metric space . as usual",
    ", define the closed ball @xmath46 for all @xmath47 and @xmath34 . also define @xmath48 if @xmath49 is a subset of @xmath23 .",

    "it is a field of neighborhoods .",

    "we wish to remark that fields of compact sets are only assumed to be semicontinuous and in the next definition we require continuity . as before ,",

    "[ rmkpeanoconvex ] it is known that a compact metric space admits a convex metric defining its topology if and only if it is a peano continuum .",

    "in this section we will apply our constructions to the study of expansive flows . in section [ secsecflow ]",
    "we define the sectional flow , which is similar to the poincar return map ( or the linear flow ) .",
    "it is also some kind of holonomy .",
    "the definition of the sectional flow does not depend on the expansivity of the flow . in sections",
    "[ seccwexpfas ] and [ secstables ] we show our results on expansive flows .",

    "assume that @xmath34 is a stable point of @xmath537 .",
    "take @xmath7 . since @xmath20 is a stable point we know that there is @xmath8 such that @xmath538 . by lemma [ lemkato ]",

    "since @xmath542 is a connected set , by theorem [ propposexp ] , we have that @xmath542 is a circle .",
    "since @xmath20 is a stable point we have that @xmath543 .",
    "we have proved that every stable point is periodic . since",
    "the set of stable points is open we conclude that @xmath23 is a periodic orbit and consequently , @xmath23 is a circle .",
    "[ propnontrivalws ] if @xmath37 is expansive with expansive constant @xmath177 and @xmath23 is a non - trivial peano continuum then there is @xmath8 such that for all @xmath34 there is a continuum @xmath544 such that @xmath114 and @xmath545 .    for the expansive constant @xmath177 consider @xmath178 from lemma [ lemkato ] . for @xmath34",

    "then a limit continuum @xmath564 of the sequence @xmath565 satisfies the thesis of the proposition .",
    "let @xmath23 be a peano continuum with a non - singular flow @xmath37 .",
    "suppose that @xmath34 has a neighborhood @xmath567 that is homeomorphic with @xmath566 . in this case",
    "we have that a connected cross section @xmath568 is a compact arc . by proposition [ propnontrivalws ]",
    "we have that @xmath569 contains a non - trivial continuum .",
    "but , since the cross section is an arc , we have that it contains an interior point ( with respect to the topology of the arc )",
    ". then there are stable points .",
    "this contradicts proposition [ propnoest ] ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> in this article we consider the general problem of translating definitions and results from the category of discrete - time dynamical systems to the category of flows . </S>",
    "<S> we consider the dynamics of homeomorphisms and flows on compact metric spaces , in particular peano continua . as a translating tool , </S>",
    "<S> we construct continuous , symmetric and monotonous fields of local cross sections for an arbitrary flow without singular points . </S>",
    "<S> next , we use this structure in the study of expansive flows on peano continua . </S>",
    "<S> we show that expansive flows admit no stable point and that every point contains a non - trivial continuum in its stable set . as a corollary </S>",
    "<S> we obtain that no peano continuum with an open set homeomorphic with the plane admits an expansive flow . </S>",
    "<S> in particular compact surface admits no expansive flow without singular points . </S>"
  ]
}
